      18             : // GenericRefCountedBase allows us to hold on to refcounted objects of any type
      19             : // (contrary to RefCounted<T> which requires knowing the type T) and, in particular,
      20             : // without having a dependency on that type. This is used for DrawTargetSkia

     330             : /**
     331             :  * This is the base class for source surfaces. These objects are surfaces

     335             :  * Although SourceSurface has thread-safe refcount, some SourceSurface cannot

     338             :  * all SourceSurface should be thread-safe.

    1265             :   /**

    1267             :    * to both the mask and source of the operation.
    1268             :    *
    1269             :    * Performance note: For some backends it is expensive to change the current
    1270             :    * transform (because transforms affect a lot of the parts of the pipeline,
    1271             :    * so new transform change can result in a pipeline flush).  To get around
    1272             :    * this, DrawTarget implementations buffer transform changes and try to only
    1273             :    * set the current transform on the backend when required.  That tracking has
    1274             :    * its own performance impact though, and ideally callers would be smart
    1275             :    * enough not to require it.  At a future date this method may stop this
    1276             :    * doing transform buffering so, if you're a consumer, please try to be smart
    1277             :    * about calling this method as little as possible.  For example, instead of
    1278             :    * concatenating a translation onto the current transform then calling
    1279             :    * FillRect, try to integrate the translation into FillRect's aRect
    1280             :    * argument's x/y offset.
